bug.short_desc: TreeFolder of TreeFullControl expands when clicked in any part

long_desc.thetext: Clicking on any part of a TreeFolder expands it, even if it were a check box. A TreeFolder should only expand when its plus-sign was clicked.

There are no plans, as far as I know, to modify Tree and TreeFullControl with this feature. If you're willing to use a yet experimental class, TreeVirtual already supports this feature. Note that TreeVirtual is still undergoing some development, so it's possible you may have to deal with some interface changes if you do choose to use it at this time. It's becoming quite stable, however, and you're certainly welcome to use it. (If you have many items in your tree, it's also a VERY lot faster to render them.)
I'll leave this ticket open, but I'm changing it to an Enhancement Request.

I still wouldn't consider this a feature. All major widget toolkits like Qt, GTK, Win32, Swing, ... behave as mentioned in the bug report (don't expand except when plus is clicked). As I understand qooxdoo strives to bring the comfort of a desktop application to the web browser. In this sense I consider it a bug if qooxdoo doesn't allow the programmer to build UI's that behave like desktop applications as close as possible.

You should be able to prevent a TreeFolder from expanding upon a single click other than on the open/close button and indentation area, by setting tree.useDoubleClick(true). This should give you the "major widget"-style effect.
